input_text.Prompt:
Given a item title and item specifications, this program will generate exciting product descriptions.

Item title:
Dell Inspiron 1750 17.3-Inch Obsidian Black Laptop - Up to 4 Hours 42 Minutes of Battery Life, MS Home and Student Software Included (Windows 7 Home Premium) [Discontinued By Manufacturer]

Item specifications:
2.1GHz Intel Pentium Dual Core T4300 Processor
4GB Memory
320GB Hard Drive, DVDR/RW Optical Drive
17.3" Display, Integrated Intel 4500 MHD Media Accelerator Graphics
Genuine Windows 7 Home Premium (64-bit), *Up to 4 Hours 42 Minutes of Battery Life
input_text.Response A:
, *8x DVD+/-R Double Layer Drive, *WiFi 802.11b/g Wireless, *HDMI Output, *Webcam, *5-in-1 Bridge Media Adapter, *Color: Obsidian Black

This powerful notebook computer is perfect for work, school, or entertainment on the go. Its sleek and stylish design features a 17.3-inch HD display and a comfortable keyboard. Powered by a 2.1GHz Intel Pentium Dual Core T4300 Processor and 4GB of memory, the Inspiron 1750 is capable of handling your everyday tasks with ease. A 320GB hard drive provides plenty of storage space for all your files, while an Integrated Intel 4500 MHD Media Accelerator Graphics delivers smooth video playback and gaming performance. You'll be able to stay connected with friends and family through the built-in webcam and wireless connectivity. The Inspiron 1750 also features a DVDR/RW optical drive and an HDMI output for connecting to an external display. This laptop is backed by a 1-year limited warranty.
input_text.Response B:
Large view, small price. Escape in the new Inspiron17 laptop's spacious Hi-def 17.3-inch display, customizable features and desktop-level performance. *Based on Dell Lab testing. Battery life varies by configuration, operating conditions and other factors. Maximum battery capacity decreases with time and use.
Includes a 2.1GHz Intel Pentium Dual Core T4300 Processor, 17.3" Display, Integrated Intel 4500 MHD Media Accelerator Graphics, 4GB Memory, and more.

label_annotations.feedback: Response A is just kind of all over the place. Responsibi is a little bit better at describing what I want it to
